data.endorsement_introduction: This COVID-19 Cover endorsement extends the following sections of your policy to cover the insured person(s) for claims relating to COVID-19, subject to the conditions and exclusions under this endorsement and the policy.

important_conditions.description: The insured person is not travelling against the travel advisory issued by the Singapore government.

The insured person must comply with all requirements and advice put in place by the Singapore and relevant overseas government, transport and accommodation provider relating to measures for minimising the risk and spread of COVID-19, including but not limited to COVID-19 vaccination requirement, pre-departure, post-arrival COVID-19 test, quarantine, isolation, and controlled itinerary.
During the trip, the insured person does not knowingly stay with any person who is having or suspected to be having a COVID-19 infection, and/or is undergoing isolation or quarantine.
The insured person or the personal representative must contact MSIG Assist immediately for any medical claims relating to COVID-19.
Conditions applicable for section 21 (Travel cancellation), 22 (Travel postponement) and 23 (Replacement of traveller):

sub_conditions.description: If a policy is purchased within 30 days before the scheduled departure date of the trip:
This policy must be purchased at least 3 days before the trip or earlier.
Both the insured person and travel companion meet these conditions on and during the 7 days before the policy purchase date:
both the insured person and travel companion do not have any COVID-19 symptoms such as fever, cough, shortness of breath, blocked or runny nose, sore throat or loss sense of smell;
both the insured person and travel companion have not tested positive for COVID-19;

both the insured person and travel companion have not been in close contact with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 person or received notification/health risk warning issued by the Singapore government.

pre_trip_benefits.description: We will pay under sections 21, 22 and 23 up to the sum insured specified under the COVID-19 Cover benefit summary if the insured person is unexpectedly and unavoidably prevented from commencing the journey, due to any of these covered reasons below which take place within 30 days before the start of the journey, but after the date of arranging this insurance and the journey.

covered_reasons.reason_description: The insured person or travel companion is tested positive for COVID-19 by a doctor or government approved personnel.
The insured person or travel companion is identified and ordered by the Singapore government to undergo quarantine or isolation due to suspected or confirmed COVID-19 infection.
The insured person9s family member is hospitalised or passed away due to COVID-19 infection.

The insured person or travel companion is denied boarding of the public transport by the local authority or transport provider on scheduled departure date due to COVID-19 symptoms and thereafter tested positive for COVID-19 by a doctor or government approved personnel within 5 days from the scheduled departure date.

notes: If a claim under section 21 (Travel cancellation), section 22 (Travel postponement) or section 23 (Replacement of traveller) results from the same event, we will pay for the claim under one of the sections only.

pre_trip_benefits.description: We will pay under sections 21, 22 and 23 up to the sum insured specified under the COVID-19 Cover benefit summary if the insured person is unexpectedly and unavoidably prevented from commencing the journey, due to any of these covered reasons below which take place within 30 days before the start of the journey, but after the date of arranging this insurance and the journey.

covered_reasons.reason_description: The insured person or travel companion is tested positive for COVID-19 by a doctor or government approved personnel.
The insured person or travel companion is identified and ordered by the Singapore government to undergo quarantine or isolation due to suspected or confirmed COVID-19 infection.
The insured person9s family member is hospitalised or passed away due to COVID-19 infection.

The insured person or travel companion is denied boarding of the public transport by the local authority or transport provider on scheduled departure date due to COVID-19 symptoms and thereafter tested positive for COVID-19 by a doctor or government approved personnel within 5 days from the scheduled departure date.

notes: If a claim under section 21 (Travel cancellation), section 22 (Travel postponement) or section 23 (Replacement of traveller) results from the same event, we will pay for the claim under one of the sections only.

pre_trip_benefits.description: We will pay under sections 21, 22 and 23 up to the sum insured specified under the COVID-19 Cover benefit summary if the insured person is unexpectedly and unavoidably prevented from commencing the journey, due to any of these covered reasons below which take place within 30 days before the start of the journey, but after the date of arranging this insurance and the journey.

covered_reasons.reason_description: The insured person or travel companion is tested positive for COVID-19 by a doctor or government approved personnel.
The insured person or travel companion is identified and ordered by the Singapore government to undergo quarantine or isolation due to suspected or confirmed COVID-19 infection.
The insured person9s family member is hospitalised or passed away due to COVID-19 infection.

The insured person or travel companion is denied boarding of the public transport by the local authority or transport provider on scheduled departure date due to COVID-19 symptoms and thereafter tested positive for COVID-19 by a doctor or government approved personnel within 5 days from the scheduled departure date.

notes: If a claim under section 21 (Travel cancellation), section 22 (Travel postponement) or section 23 (Replacement of traveller) results from the same event, we will pay for the claim under one of the sections only.

during_trip_benefits.description: We will extend section 15 to provide medical and travel assistance for the sections listed under During trip benefits due to COVID-19.

information_required: Insured person details: Full-name, NRIC/FIN number, policy number, contact number
Caller details (if not the insured person): Name, relationship, contact number
Nature of help required: Location, brief description of emergency and help required

notes: Please refer to section 15 for the full terms and conditions.

during_trip_benefits.description: We will pay benefits under Section 6 and 16 up to the sum insured specified under the COVID-19 Cover benefit summary if the insured person is tested positive for COVID-19 by a doctor or a government approved personnel outside Singapore within the first 90 days of the trip.
what_is_not_covered: Section 6 will not pay any COVID-19 treatment expenses which are covered by any government or national healthcare programme.
notes: We will pay benefits under Section 6 and 16 up to 60 days from the date the insured person was first tested positive for COVID-19 by a doctor or a government approved personnel.
Claims due to COVID-19 infection diagnosed from test done after the 90th day from the start of the trip are not covered.

during_trip_benefits.description: We will pay benefits under Section 6 and 16 up to the sum insured specified under the COVID-19 Cover benefit summary if the insured person is tested positive for COVID-19 by a doctor or a government approved personnel outside Singapore within the first 90 days of the trip.
notes: We will pay benefits under Section 6 and 16 up to 60 days from the date the insured person was first tested positive for COVID-19 by a doctor or a government approved personnel.
Claims due to COVID-19 infection diagnosed from test done after the 90th day from the start of the trip are not covered.

during_trip_benefits.description: We will pay under section 24 up to the sum insured specified under the COVID-19 Cover benefit summary if the insured person is unexpectedly prevented from continuing the journey, and the trip is unavoidably disrupted due to any of these covered reasons below which take place within the first 90 days of the trip.

covered_reasons.reason_description: The insured person is tested positive for COVID-19 by a doctor or government approved personnel.
The insured person is specifically identified and ordered by the local government at the overseas destination to undergo quarantine or isolation due to suspected or confirmed COVID-19 infection.
The insured person9s family member is hospitalised or passed away due to COVID-19 infection.

The insured person is denied boarding of the public transport by the local authority or transport provider on the scheduled departure date due to COVID-19 symptoms and thereafter tested positive for COVID-19 by a doctor or government approved personnel within 5 days from scheduled departure date.

notes: Claims due to COVID-19 infection diagnosed from test done after the 90th day from the start of the trip are not covered.

during_trip_benefits.description: We will pay (a) and/or (b) under section 29 for the covered reasons below which take place within the first 90 days of the trip outside Singapore resulting in the insured person having to make a direct trip home.

covered_reasons.reason_description: The insured person is tested positive for COVID-19 by a doctor or government approved personnel.
The insured person is specifically identified and ordered by the local government at the overseas destination to undergo quarantine or isolation due to suspected or confirmed COVID-19 infection.
The insured person9s family member is hospitalised or passed away due to COVID-19 infection.

The insured person is denied boarding of the public transport by the local authority or transport provider on the scheduled departure date due to COVID-19 symptoms and thereafter tested positive for COVID-19 by a doctor or government approved personnel within 5 days from scheduled departure date.

notes: For covered reasons 1 to 4, we will pay up to the sum insured as specified under COVID-19 Cover benefit summary.
For covered reasons 5 to 7, we will pay 50% of the eligible expenses up to the sum insured as specified under COVID-19 Cover benefit summary.
Claims due to COVID-19 infection diagnosed from test done after the 90th day from the start of the trip are not covered.

reasons.reason_description: The insured person is tested positive for COVID-19 by a doctor or government approved personnel.
The insured person is specifically identified and ordered by the local government at the overseas destination to undergo quarantine or isolation due to suspected or confirmed COVID-19 infection.
The insured person9s family member is hospitalised or passed away due to COVID-19 infection.

The insured person is denied boarding of the public transport by the local authority or transport provider on the scheduled departure date due to COVID-19 symptoms and thereafter tested positive for COVID-19 by a doctor or government approved personnel within 5 days from scheduled departure date.
The travel companion is tested positive for COVID-19 by a doctor or government approved personnel.
The travel companion is specifically identified and ordered by the local government at the overseas destination to undergo quarantine or isolation due to suspected or confirmed COVID-19 infection.

The travel companion is denied boarding of the public transport by the local authority or transport provider on the scheduled departure date due to COVID-19 symptoms and thereafter tested positive for COVID-19 by a doctor or government approved personnel within 5 days from scheduled departure date.

during_trip_benefits.description: We will pay under section 30 for insured person to continue with the original scheduled journey due to any of these covered reasons below which take place within the first 90 days of the trip outside Singapore.

covered_reasons.reason_description: The insured person is tested positive for COVID-19 by a doctor or government approved personnel.
The insured person is specifically identified and ordered by the local government at the overseas destination to undergo quarantine or isolation due to suspected or confirmed COVID-19 infection.

The insured person is denied boarding of the public transport by the local authority or transport provider on the scheduled departure date due to COVID-19 symptoms and thereafter tested positive for COVID-19 by a doctor or government approved personnel within 5 days from scheduled departure date.

notes: For covered reasons 1 to 3, we will pay up to the sum insured as specified under COVID-19 Cover benefit summary.
For covered reasons 4 to 6 we will pay 50% of the additional travel expenses up to the sum insured as specified under COVID-19 Cover benefit summary.
Claims due to COVID-19 infection diagnosed from test done after the 90th day from the start of the trip are not covered.

reasons.reason_description: The insured person is tested positive for COVID-19 by a doctor or government approved personnel.
The insured person is specifically identified and ordered by the local government at the overseas destination to undergo quarantine or isolation due to suspected or confirmed COVID-19 infection.

The insured person is denied boarding of the public transport by the local authority or transport provider on the scheduled departure date due to COVID-19 symptoms and thereafter tested positive for COVID-19 by a doctor or government approved personnel within 5 days from scheduled departure date.
The travel companion is tested positive for COVID-19 by a doctor or government approved personnel.
The travel companion is specifically identified and ordered by the local government at the overseas destination to undergo quarantine or isolation due to suspected or confirmed COVID-19 infection.

The travel companion is denied boarding of the public transport by the local authority or transport provider on the scheduled departure date due to COVID-19 symptoms and thereafter tested positive for COVID-19 by a doctor or government approved personnel within 5 days from scheduled departure date.

automatic_extension_of_cover.description: If insured person9s homeward journey cannot be completed before the end date shown in the policy, cover will stay in force due to any of these covered reasons below without additional premium for an insured person.

extension_conditions.reason: The insured person is hospitalised due to COVID-19 infection.

The insured person is tested positive for COVID-19 by a doctor or government approved personnel; or specifically identified and ordered by the local government at the overseas destination to undergo quarantine or isolation due to suspected or confirmed COVID-19 infection.

sub_reasons.description: Tested positive for COVID-19 by a doctor or government approved personnel.
Specifically identified and ordered by the local government at the overseas destination to undergo quarantine or isolation due to suspected or confirmed COVID-19 infection.

notes: If 48 hours after discharge from hospital, quarantine or isolation, the insured person is unable to return to Singapore, further extension of the period of insurance will require top-up of premium, unless MSIG Assist has assessed the insured person to be unfit for travel back to Singapore.

overseas_quarantine_daily_benefit.description: We will pay the daily benefit for each complete 24-hour period of quarantine or isolation up to the sum insured specified under the COVID-19 Cover benefit summary if the insured person is tested positive for COVID-19 by a doctor or government approved personnel within the first 90 days of the trip and ordered to undergo quarantine or isolation at a government approved hotel or COVID-19 medical facility outside Singapore.
payment_conditions: This benefit is payable provided the insured person is liable to pay for the charges incurred at the government approved hotel or COVID-19 medical facility.
Government approved hotel refers to hotel approved by the government for the purpose of COVID-19 quarantine or any hotel which you are residing in if permitted by the local government.
what_is_not_covered: We will not pay claims for quarantine or isolation served at other location other than at government approved hotel or COVID-19 medical facility.
This benefit will not pay if section 12 (Overseas hospitalisation daily benefit) or section 13 (Overseas ICU hospitalisation daily benefit) pays claim for the same event.

covid19_cover_conditions.description: When submitting claims relating to COVID-19 Cover, it must be accompanied with all applicable document(s) for the approved travel arrangement issued by the Singapore and/or foreign government, including the vaccination records, negative test result for the mandatory pre-departure COVID-19 diagnostic test done to meet regulatory requirement for travel, if required.
We reserve the right to terminate the COVID-19 Cover by giving you 14 days’ notice in writing.
For during trip benefits, we will only pay claims incurred within the period of insurance.

The benefits under COVID-19 Cover shall operate in accordance with the terms and conditions under this endorsement and the policy. If there are terms and conditions that are inconsistent, the terms and conditions under the COVID-19 Cover shall prevail.

covid19_cover_exclusions.description: claims due to circumstances which you, the insured person or the travel companion knew before the purchase of this policy or trip that may lead to a claim under this policy;

changes to travel advisory or restrictions, travel arrangement, COVID-19 prevention measures issued by any government or authority relating to epidemic or pandemic at your planned destination or Singapore;

any medical test, vaccination, quarantine, or isolation required by the Singapore or overseas government, transport or accommodation provider that applies broadly to general travellers based on departing or arriving country, taken for the purpose of obtaining approval to travel for the journey;

medical expenses incurred in Singapore, or after 60 days from the date the insured person first tested positive for COVID-19 by a doctor or government approved personnel during the trip outside Singapore.
vaccination, including the side effects and complications resulting from vaccination;
pre-existing medical condition and its complications, regardless of whether it is resulting from or complicated by COVID-19 infection.

Except for benefits extended under COVID-19 Cover under a single return trip policy or under an annual policy if COVID-19 Cover is selected and stated on the schedule or endorsement, this policy excludes any loss, damage, liability, expense, fines, penalties or any other amount directly or indirectly caused by, in connection with, or in any way involving or arising out of any of the following –including any fear or threat thereof, whether actual or perceived: a) Coronavirus (COVID-19) including any mutation or variation thereof; or b) Pandemic or epidemic, as declared as such by the World Health Organisation or any governmental authority.

data.policy_introduction: This is your TravelEasy® or TravelEasy® Pre-Ex insurance policy document. It is important that you read this policy document together with the schedule and any amendment or endorsement issued to make sure that you have the protection you need and to avoid any misunderstanding.
data.important_notice: The insurance cover provided under this policy depends on the accuracy and completeness of the information given by the insured. The insured must disclose all facts they know or should know; otherwise, they may not be covered under the policy.
data.how_insurance_operates: The policy is a contract between the insurer and the insured person named in the schedule. The application form, declaration, and any information provided during application form the basis of the contract. In return for paying the premium, the insurer provides insurance cover as described in the policy during the period of insurance or any subsequent period for which the premium is paid and accepted.
data.promise_of_service: The company commits to providing a high standard of service and to meeting any claims covered by the policy honestly, fairly, and promptly. They encourage contact through an agent or broker, or directly if no intermediary is used, to address any concerns.

sub_sections.section_name: Accidental death and permanent total disability
Funeral expenses due to an accident
Legal expenses for wrongful arrest or detention

policy_guide.description: Those events we do not insure under the policy

general_important_conditions.description: The round trip must begin and end in Singapore.
At the time of arranging the trip or taking out this insurance, neither you nor any other insured person is aware of any circumstances which are likely to lead to a claim under the policy.

At the time you send us your application for this insurance, none of the intended insured persons have already left Singapore on any trip meant to be covered by this insurance. An insured person is not covered for the entire trip if they leave Singapore before the start of the period of insurance.
Any insured child under the age of 12 years must be accompanied by a parent or adult guardian during the trip.

If an insured person has ever been refused cover or had special terms placed on them by any insurer for travel insurance, they must declare this at the point of application and we must accept them, or there will be no cover for them.
The country of residence for all insured persons is Singapore.
The insured persons are not travelling against the advice of a doctor or for the purpose of getting medical treatment.
For TravelEasy®, the insured persons must be in good health or free from physical defects.
To be eligible for cover under TravelEasy® Pre-Ex plans, the insured person must meet all the conditions stated under section 52 - Pre-Ex Critical Care.

definitions.definition: A sudden and unexpected event which results in bodily injury, disability or death of the insured person.

An act, including using force or violence, of any person or group of people, whether acting alone or on behalf of or in connection with any organisation, committed for political, religious or ideological purposes including the intention to influence any government or to put the civilian population in fear for those purposes.

definitions.term: Acute onset of a pre-existing medical condition
definitions.definition: Refers to a sudden, unexpected and rapid deterioration of the insured person’s pre-existing medical condition resulting in a serious medical condition.

The necessary administrative costs and other expenses due to change of traveller (for section 23) or travel itinerary including the cost of economy class public transport or standard room, provided the original air ticket or accommodation booking cannot be amended at a lower cost, less any refund recovered. The transport or accommodation of the altered travel itinerary must not be of higher class or category that which was purchased in the original itinerary.
A person aged 18 years or above at the start of any trip.

A person who is aged over one month and below 18 years, or below 23 years if studying full-time in a recognised institution of higher learning, at the start of any trip. Recognised institute of higher learning refers to Singapore or overseas education institutions which are licensed by the government of the country to provide post-secondary or higher education.
refers to: 1. Coronavirus disease (COVID-19); 2. Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2); or 3. any mutation or variation of SARS-CoV-2; or COVID-19.

A legally registered dental practitioner qualified to practise in line with the laws of the country in which the practice is granted. The dentist must not be an insured person, an insured person’s family member, travel companion, a business partner, an employee or employer of an insured person, or a person related to an insured person in any way.

A legally registered medical practitioner qualified to practise western medicine and surgery in line with the laws of the country in which the practice is granted. The doctor must not be an insured person, an insured person’s family member, travel companion, a business partner, an employee or employer of an insured person, or a person related to an insured person in any way.
A ticket granting admission to theme parks, musicals, plays, theatre or drama performances, concerts and sports events but excludes movie tickets.

The insured person’s husband or wife, child, parent, stepparent, parent-in-law,
grandparent, grandparent-in-law, great-grandparent, great-grandparent-in-law,
grandchild, great- grandchild, brother, brother-in-law, sister, sister-in-law.
Your residential address and the address of any insured person in Singapore.

A lawful establishment set up to care for and treat sick and injured people, and which
has 24-hour nursing services provided by registered graduate nurses, one or more
doctors available at all times and organised facilities for diagnosis and major surgery.
This must not be mainly a clinic, a place for alcoholics or drug addicts, a nursing, rest
or convalescent home, community hospital, home for the aged, or a similar
establishment.

Any sudden and unexpected deterioration of health of an insured person due to a
medical condition contracted, which began or developed during the journey outside
Singapore, which needs treatment by a doctor or TCM practitioner.

The legal husband or wife, parent, biological child, legally adopted child or brother or
sister of an insured person.

Bodily injury which happens during the journey, caused only and directly by an
accident and not by physical impairment, sickness, disease or anything which happens
gradually and affects physical or mental health.
The person named as Insured or Policyholder in the schedule.

The person or people described in the schedule, who live in Singapore for whom the
insurance is arranged. Children are not named in the schedule unless travelling on
their own.

means an in-patient stay in the hospital by the insured person where the treatment
is being received for which room and board charges were made by the hospital, and
this excludes in-patient stay by the insured person under observation in a ward.

1. Under TravelEasy® cover:
a) For a single return trip:
A full return trip lasting no more than 182 days in a row during the period of
insurance, beginning at the time the insured person leaves their home or
workplace within Singapore for the purpose of travelling abroad and ending up
to three hours after the insured person returns to Singapore or on the end
date of the period of insurance shown in the schedule, whichever is sooner.
b) For an annual plan:
A trip lasting no more than 90 days in a row during the period of insurance,
beginning at the time the insured person leaves their home or workplace
within Singapore for the purpose of travelling abroad and ending up to three
hours after the insured person returns to Singapore or on the end date of the
period of insurance shown in the schedule, whichever is sooner.
2. Under TravelEasy® Pre-Ex cover:
A single full return trip lasting no more than 30 days in a row during the period of
insurance, beginning at the time the insured person leaves their home or
workplace within Singapore for the purpose of travelling abroad and ending up to
three hours after the insured person returns to Singapore or on the end date of
the period of insurance shown in the schedule, whichever is sooner.

means riot, strike, civil commotion, natural disaster or situations which threaten the
insured person’s health or disrupt their trip that were publicised or reported by the
media or through travel advice issued by an authority (local or foreign) before the
policy was taken up or before the trip was booked (in the case of an annual plan).

means laptop or notebook, which is a mobile computer that comes with a non-
detachable full-sized keyboard and a flip-up screen of at least 12 inches.

refers to handheld devices like mobile phones, tablets, phablets, netbooks, personal
digital assistants and similar equipment, excluding laptop computer.

An event or force of nature that has catastrophic consequences, such as avalanche,
earthquake, flood, typhoon, hurricane, tornado, tsunami or volcanic eruption.
The period of insurance shown in the schedule.

1. Under TravelEasy® cover, it means:
Any pre-existing medical or physical conditions of any insured person which have
needed consultation or treatment including any recurring, chronic or continuing
illness or condition during the 12-month period before the start of the journey.
For the purpose of an annual policy, we will treat medical or physical conditions
for which a claim has been made on a previous journey as a pre-existing medical
condition in terms of any future journey.
2. Under TravelEasy® Pre-Ex cover, it means:
Any pre-existing medical or physical conditions of any insured person which have
needed consultation or treatment including any recurring, chronic or continuing
illness or condition before the start of the journey.

Any licensed and scheduled land, sea or air transport which has fixed and established
routes and which any member of the public can join at a recognised stop and pay a
fare. This excludes taxis, private hire vehicles such as buses or coaches that are
chartered or arranged as part of a tour even if the services are regularly scheduled.

Area A
Brunei, Cambodia, Indonesia, Laos, East and West Malaysia, Myanmar, Philippines,
Thailand and Vietnam.
Area B
Australia, China (not including Inner Mongolia and Tibet), Hong Kong, India, Japan,
Korea, Macau, New Zealand, Sri Lanka, Taiwan and including countries in Area A.
Area C
Worldwide, including countries in Areas A and B.

The schedule containing details of you, any insured person, the type of cover you
have chosen and the period of insurance. The schedule forms part of the policy.

Means a critical or dangerous condition which, in the opinion of a doctor, needs
urgent treatment to avoid death or serious impairment to a person’s immediate or
long-term health.

Means a condition which, in the opinion of the company or of MSIG Assist doctor, is a
critically ill state of health that requires emergency medical treatment in order to
avoid death or serious impairment to the insured person’s immediate or long-term
health.

A traditional Chinese medicine practitioner who is legally licensed medical
practitioner, including acupuncturists and bonesetters, who is qualified to practise
traditional Chinese medicine in line with the laws which apply in the country in which
the practice is granted. The TCM practitioner must not be an insured person, an
insured person’s family member, travel companion, a business partner, an
employee or employer of an insured person, or a person related to an insured
person in any way.

Means the conclusive diagnosis by a doctor of an illness that is expected to result in
death within 12 months.

A person who has made travel bookings to accompany the insured person for the
trip.
The type of cover you chose when you applied for the insurance.

sub_definitions.description: TravelEasy® Pre-Ex plans: Pre-Ex Standard, Pre-Ex Elite, Pre-Ex Premier
Individual cover, adult and children cover or family cover

definitions.definition: A policy issued to you for the insured person named in the schedule.
A policy issued to you for you and your biological or legally adopted children.
A policy issued to you for the people named in the schedule as insured person who are travelling as a family.

sub_definitions.description: you and your husband or wife travelling together on the same journey
you and your husband or wife and your biological or legally adopted children travelling together on the same journey
you and your husband or wife
you and your husband or wife and your biological or legally adopted children

definitions.definition: A policy issued to you taking out cover on behalf of two or more insured persons named in the schedule who are travelling as a group.
MSIG Insurance (Singapore) Pte. Ltd.

benefits.description: We will pay $100 for every full six hours in a row of delay if, while travelling on a scheduled flight, the insured person’s flight is diverted due to poor weather conditions, natural disasters, emergency medical treatment for a fellow passenger, or the mechanical breakdown of the aircraft; and this prevents the insured person from continuing their journey and they are delayed from arriving at their planned destination.

maximum_payouts.coverage_type: each insured person (Premier Plan)
total for adult and children cover or family cover

benefits.description: If the insured person is denied boarding a scheduled flight which they have a confirmed reservation due to overbooking, we will pay for every full six hours in a row of delay.

maximum_payouts.coverage_type: per 6 hours, maximum per insured person (Premier Plan)
maximum_payouts.premier_plan: $200 per six hours, up to $400 per insured person
maximum_payouts.elite_plan: $150 per six hours, up to $300 per insured person
maximum_payouts.standard_plan: $100 per six hours, up to $200 per insured person

maximum_payouts.coverage_type: total for adult and children cover or family cover

benefits.description: If during a trip, the insured person’s incoming scheduled public transport arrives late at the transfer point outside Singapore and they miss the onward scheduled public transport, we will pay for every full six hours in a row of delay.

maximum_payouts.coverage_type: per 6 hours, maximum per insured person (Premier Plan)
maximum_payouts.premier_plan: $200 per six hours, up to $400 per insured person
maximum_payouts.elite_plan: $150 per six hours, up to $300 per insured person
maximum_payouts.standard_plan: $100 per six hours, up to $200 per insured person

maximum_payouts.coverage_type: total for adult and children cover or family cover

benefits.description: Pays for unused travel fare, accommodation charges and deposits that cannot be recovered, and for reasonable additional travel expenses, if the journey is unexpectedly and unavoidably cut short or abandoned due to covered reasons after it begins.

maximum_payouts.coverage_type: each insured person
total for adult and children cover or family cover

benefits.description: We will pay for the reasonable additional travel expenses incurred by the insured person to make changes to continue with the journey, if their trip is disrupted due to specified covered reasons.

maximum_payouts.coverage_type: each insured person
total for adult and children cover or family cover

benefits.description: If the homeward journey cannot be completed before the end date shown in your policy, cover will stay in force without an extra premium for an insured person for up to 14 days if any public transport in which that insured person is travelling as a fare-paying passenger is delayed; or 30 days if the intended return journey is prevented due to the insured person’s injury or illness arising from a cause covered under this policy.

We will pay for every full six hours in a row of delay if the insured person’s checked-in baggage is temporarily lost or misdirected by the carrier and not returned within six hours after their arrival.
Accidental loss of or damage to personal baggage, including clothing, personal belongings, one laptop and one mobile device occurring during the journey outside Singapore.

maximum_payouts.coverage_type: maximum amount per insured person
total for adult and children cover or family cover

benefits.description: Accidental loss of or damage to bridal clothing and ceremonial clothing, wedding rings, jewellery and wedding accessories owned by or hired or on loan to the adult insured person for their wedding.

maximum_payouts.coverage_type: each adult insured person

benefits.description: Cost of getting replacement passports, travel tickets and other relevant travel documents as a result of accidental loss or damage during the journey while overseas, and reasonable additional travel expenses if the loss arises out of a robbery, burglary or theft.
We will pay for loss of an insured person’s cash, banknotes or traveller’s cheques carried for social and domestic purposes arising out of robbery, burglary or theft while outside Singapore.

maximum_payouts.coverage_type: maximum payment per insured person
total maximum payment for adult and children cover or family cover

benefits.description: If the adult insured person suffers financial loss as a direct result of the fraudulent use of their personal credit card through unauthorised charges made overseas following its loss arising out of robbery, burglary or theft.

maximum_payouts.coverage_type: maximum payment per adult insured person

benefits.description: If the adult insured person suffers an injury during the journey outside Singapore which within 90 days of its happening is the only cause of their death, we will pay the outstanding balance on their personal credit card account up to the date of the accident.

maximum_payouts.coverage_type: each adult insured person

benefits.description: Cover against all amounts which the insured person becomes legally responsible for paying compensation for accidents which result in death or injury of any other person or loss of or damage to property belonging to other people, during the journey outside Singapore.

maximum_payouts.coverage_type: each adult insured person
each insured child
total for adult and children cover or family cover

benefits.section_name: Legal expenses for wrongful arrest or detention
benefits.description: Covers the legal costs and expenses which the insured person legally has to pay due to wrongful arrest or detention by any government or local authority during the journey outside Singapore.

maximum_payouts.coverage_type: each insured person
total for adult and children cover or family cover

benefits.description: We will pay benefits if the insured person suffers accidental death or injury as a result of taking part in or practising for specified activities for leisure and non-competitive purpose, with a licensed operator, under Elite and Premier Plans only.
Covers adult insured person for loss or damage to golfing equipment, non-refundable green fees, and cost of celebratory drinks for a hole-in-one scored during the journey outside Singapore.

maximum_payouts.coverage_type: golfing equipment (each adult insured person)
green fees (each adult insured person)
hole-in-one (each adult insured person)

benefits.description: Pays the cost for any prepaid or unused portion of an entertainment ticket that the insured person is unable to use overseas due to covered reasons.

maximum_payouts.coverage_type: each insured person
total for adult and children cover or family cover

benefits.description: Pays the excess amount legally payable by the insured person under a vehicle rental agreement for loss or damage to the rental vehicle, under set terms.

maximum_payouts.coverage_type: each adult insured person

benefits.description: Pays reasonable costs for returning a rental vehicle to the nearest hire depot if due to the insured person's injury or illness they are unable to return it.

maximum_payouts.coverage_type: each adult insured person

benefits.description: Covers pet care costs (stay at pet hotel/kennel/cattery) if the insured person cannot return to Singapore on the scheduled return date due to injury, illness, or transport delay.

maximum_payouts.coverage_type: each adult insured person

benefits.description: Covers losses from acts of terrorism (excluding those involving biological weapons, chemical agents, or nuclear devices). Pays based on the limits of all other sections. For group cover: the most payable is $5,000,000 for each terrorism event.

maximum_payouts.coverage_type: each insured person
total for adult and children cover or family cover

benefits.description: If the public transport in which the insured person is travelling is hijacked, pays for every full six hours of delay.

maximum_payouts.coverage_type: per 6 hours, maximum per insured person (Premier Plan)
maximum_payouts.premier_plan: $300 per six hours, up to $6,000 per insured person
maximum_payouts.elite_plan: $200 per six hours, up to $4,000 per insured person
maximum_payouts.standard_plan: $100 per six hours, up to $2,000 per insured person

maximum_payouts.coverage_type: total for adult and children cover or family cover

benefits.description: If the insured person is kidnapped or wrongly held, abducted or restrained by a criminal, we will pay the benefit for every full six hours in a row during the journey outside Singapore.

maximum_payouts.coverage_type: per 6 hours, maximum per insured person (Premier Plan)
maximum_payouts.premier_plan: $300 per six hours, up to $6,000 per insured person
maximum_payouts.elite_plan: $200 per six hours, up to $4,000 per insured person
maximum_payouts.standard_plan: $100 per six hours, up to $2,000 per insured person

maximum_payouts.coverage_type: total for adult and children cover or family cover
